alert.note: Alert for Pitt (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 23 at 1:04PM EDT until September 23 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport/Morehead City has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Pitt County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 230 PM EDT. * At 104 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding in Greenville and Winterville. Between 4 and 9 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greenville, Winterville, Ayden, House, Shelmerdine, Pactolus, Calico, Black Jack, Dowdy Ficklen Stadium, East Carolina University, Pitt Greenville Airport and Simpson. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
